fields.name: permanentToken
fields.description: Data of a specific permanent token.

fields.name: permanentTokens
fields.description: Data of all existing permanent tokens.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: Data of a specific domain.

fields.name: domains
fields.description: Data of all existing domains.

fields.name: event
fields.description: Data of a specific event.

fields.name: events
fields.description: Data of all existing events.

fields.name: facts
fields.description: Facts of all domains combined. Usually simple data that can be represented in one value.

fields.name: statistics
fields.description: Statistics of all domains combined. Usually data that needs to be represented in a list or chart.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Permanent token identifier. Use this value for authentication.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the permanent token.

fields.name: created
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was updated.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the
`date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO
8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: Domain
types.description:
Domains are required to track views. You can create as many domains as you want,
but it's recommended to create on domain per project/site. This allows you to
view facts and statistics separately.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Domain identifier.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the domain.

fields.name: facts
fields.description: Facts about a domain. Usually simple data that can be represented in one value.

fields.name: statistics
fields.description: Statistics of a domain. Usually data that needs to be represented in a list or chart.

fields.name: created
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was updated.

types.name: Facts
types.description: Facts about a domain. Usually simple data that can be represented in one value.

fields.name: activeVisitors
fields.description: Number of visitors currently on your site.

fields.name: averageViews
fields.description: Average number of visitors per day during the last 14 days.

fields.name: averageDuration
fields.description: Average visit duration of the last 14 days in milliseconds.

fields.name: viewsToday
fields.description: Number of unique views today.

fields.name: viewsMonth
fields.description: Number of unique views this month.

fields.name: viewsYear
fields.description: Number of unique views this year.

types.name: UnsignedInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: DomainStatistics
types.description: Statistics of a domain. Usually data that needs to be represented in a list or chart.

fields.name: views
fields.description: Amount of views grouped by day, month or year.

args.name: limit
args.description: Number of entries to return. Starts with the current day, month or year depending on the chosen interval.

fields.name: pages
fields.description: Pages viewed by your visitors.

fields.name: referrers
fields.description: Where your visitors are coming from.

fields.name: durations
fields.description: Average visit duration by day, month or year.

args.name: limit
args.description: Number of entries to return. Starts with the current day, month or year depending on the chosen interval.

fields.name: systems
fields.description: Systems used by your visitors.

fields.name: devices
fields.description: Devices used by your visitors.

fields.name: browsers
fields.description: Browsers used by your visitors.

fields.name: sizes
fields.description: Screen or browser sizes used by your visitors.

fields.name: languages
fields.description: Browser languages used by your visitors.

enumValues.name: DAILY
enumValues.description: Group by day.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Group by month.

enumValues.name: YEARLY
enumValues.description: Group by year.

enumValues.name: UNIQUE
enumValues.description: Unique site views.

enumValues.name: TOTAL
enumValues.description: Total page views.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Date of visits.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Amount of occurrences.

enumValues.name: TOP
enumValues.description: Entries with the most occurrences will be shown at the top.

enumValues.name: RECENT
enumValues.description: Entries sorted by time. The newest entries will be shown at the top.

enumValues.name: NEW
enumValues.description: Entries that appeared for the first time will be shown at the top.

enumValues.name: LAST_24_HOURS
enumValues.description: Data of the last 24 hours.

enumValues.name: LAST_7_DAYS
enumValues.description: Data of the last 7 days.

enumValues.name: LAST_30_DAYS
enumValues.description: Data of the last 30 days.

enumValues.name: LAST_6_MONTHS
enumValues.description: Data of the last 6 months.

fields.name: id
fields.description: URL of the page.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Amount of occurrences.

fields.name: created
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

enumValues.name: WITH_SOURCE
enumValues.description: Use source parameter instead of referrer when available.

enumValues.name: NO_SOURCE
enumValues.description: Omit source parameters and show referrers only.

enumValues.name: ONLY_SOURCE
enumValues.description: Omit referrers and show source parameters only.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Either the URL of the referrer or the source parameter of the page to indicate where the visit comes from.

enumValues.description: Omit model name.

types.name: Event
types.description:
Events are required to track actions. You can create as many events as you want.
This allows you to analyse specific actions happening on your sites. Like a
button click or a successful sale.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Event identifier.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the event.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the event. Allows you to decide how Ackee should display the data of this event in the UI.

fields.name: statistics
fields.description:
Statistics of an event. The data is available in different types, depending on
whether they are to be shown in a chart or list.

fields.name: created
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was updated.

enumValues.name: TOTAL_CHART
enumValues.description: The UI will display the data of this event as a bar chart with totalized values.

enumValues.name: AVERAGE_CHART
enumValues.description: The UI will display the data of this event as a bar chart with average values.

enumValues.name: TOTAL_LIST
enumValues.description: The UI will display the data of this event as a list of entries with totalized values.

enumValues.name: AVERAGE_LIST
enumValues.description: The UI will display the data of this event as a list of entries with average values.

types.name: EventStatistics
types.description:
Statistics of an event. The data is available in different types, depending on
whether they are to be shown in a chart or list.

fields.name: chart
fields.description:
The chart type should be used when showing events in a chart. It groups events
by an interval and shows the total or average sum of values on each entry.

args.name: limit
args.description: Number of entries to return. Starts with the current day, month or year depending on the chosen interval.

fields.name: list
fields.description:
The list type should be used when showing events in a list. It groups events
by their key and shows the total or average sum of values on each entry.

enumValues.name: TOTAL
enumValues.description: Total sum of values.

enumValues.name: AVERAGE
enumValues.description: Average sum of values.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Date of the event.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Sum of values on that date.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

enumValues.name: TOTAL
enumValues.description: Total sum of values.

enumValues.name: AVERAGE
enumValues.description: Average sum of values.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Key of the event.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Sum of values of the current event key.

fields.name: created
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

fields.name: createToken
fields.description: Create a new token. The token is required in order to access protected data.

fields.name: deleteToken
fields.description: Delete an existing token. The token than can't be used anymore for authentication.

fields.name: createPermanentToken
fields.description: Create a new permanent token. The token is required in order to access protected data.

fields.name: updatePermanentToken
fields.description: Update an existing permanent token.

fields.name: deletePermanentToken
fields.description: Delete an existing permanent token. The token than can't be used anymore for authentication.

fields.name: createRecord
fields.description: Create a new record to track a page visit.

fields.name: updateRecord
fields.description: Update an existing record to track the duration of a visit.

fields.name: createDomain
fields.description: Create a new domain.

fields.name: updateDomain
fields.description: Update an existing domain.

fields.name: deleteDomain
fields.description: Delete an existing domain.

fields.name: createEvent
fields.description: Create a new event.

fields.name: updateEvent
fields.description: Update an existing event.

fields.name: deleteEvent
fields.description: Delete an existing event.

fields.name: createAction
fields.description: Create a new action to track an event.

fields.name: updateAction
fields.description: Update an existing action.

types.name: Record
types.description:
Page views will be stored in records. They contain data about the visit and
user. Ackee tries its best to keep tracked data anonymized. Several steps are
used to avoid that users are identifiable, while still providing helpful analytics.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: Key that will be used to group similar actions in the UI.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description:
Numerical value that is added to all other numerical values of the key, grouped by day, month or year.
Use '1' to count how many times an event occurred or a price (e.g. '1.99') to
see the sum of successful checkouts in a shop.

inputFields.description: Details allow you to store more data along with the associated action.

types.description: Floats that will have a value greater than 0.

types.name: Action
types.description: Event entries will be stored as actions.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Action identifier.

fields.name: key

fields.name: value
fields.description:
Numerical value that is added to all other numerical values of the key, grouped by day, month or year.
Use '1' to count how many times an event occurred or a price (e.g. '1.99') to
see the sum of successful checkouts in a shop.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description:
Numerical value that is added to all other numerical values of the key, grouped by day, month or year.
Use '1' to count how many times an event occurred or a price (e.g. '1.99') to
see the sum of successful checkouts in a shop.
Reset an existing value using 'null'.

inputFields.name: details

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: client
directives.description: Direct the client to resolve this field locally, either from the cache or local resolvers.

args.name: always
args.description:
When true, the client will never use the cache for this value. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#forcing-resolvers-with-clientalways-true

directives.name: export
directives.description:
Export this locally resolved field as a variable to be used in the remainder of this query. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#using-client-fields-as-variables

args.name: as
args.description: The variable name to export this field as.

directives.name: connection
directives.description:
Specify a custom store key for this result. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/advanced/caching/#the-connection-directive

args.name: filter
args.description: An array of query argument names to include in the generated custom store key.
